# Daily AI Newsletter Digest - 14/11/2025

## ğŸ”¥ Top Stories
- OpenAI has released GPT-5.1, a major upgrade to its flagship model, with improved conversational styles and adaptive reasoning capabilities. The new model includes two modes: "Instant" for fast responses and everyday tasks, and "Thinking" for deeper reasoning and complex tasks.
- Anthropic is investing $50 billion in AI-focused data centers with Fluidstack, marking a significant push for domestic AI leadership.
- Elf Labs has acquired over 100 historic trademarks featuring legendary characters, positioning itself as a major player in the character IP market, and has launched Marble, a commercial world model that generates persistent 3D environments from text, images, videos, or 3D layouts.

## ğŸ¤– AI Models & Research
- OpenAI's GPT-5.1 introduces eight new personality presets, allowing for more flexibility in tone and style. The model has been described as a "full reboot of the ChatGPT experience" with sharper reasoning, faster responses, and brand-new personalities.
- Baidu has released an open-source multimodal AI model, ERNIE-4.5-VL-28B-A3B-Thinking, which rivals the performance of larger competing systems.
- Researchers from Cognizant AI Labs and the University of Texas at Austin have developed a system that uses neuroevolution to discover effective policies for land-use planning, aiming to minimize carbon emissions and the cost of land-use changes.

## ğŸ› ï¸ Tools & Products
- ElevenLabs has launched an AI marketplace that lets brands use famous voices for ads, connecting brands with voice rights owners and ensuring permission and fair compensation.
- Stripe AI provides software development kits for integrating Stripe with large language models and agent frameworks.
- Valve has announced three new products: the Steam Frame, a wireless VR headset with pancake optics, the Steam Machine, a more powerful follow-up to the Steam Deck, and the Steam Controller, designed to replace a mouse.
- Homebrew 5.0.0 is now available with significant changes, including download concurrency by default and official support for Linux ARM64/AArch64.

## ğŸ“° Industry News
- OpenAI spent $5.02 billion on inference alone with Microsoft Azure in the first half of 2025, with inference costs rising consistently over the last 18 months.
- Waymo has started offering fully autonomous freeway rides without a human specialist in the car to fare-paying riders in the US.
- Microsoft aims to double its total data-center footprint over the next two years, with its newest AI super factory sitting within a set of two-story structures in Atlanta.
- Coinbase plans to leave Delaware and reincorporate in Texas due to Texas' more predictable and efficient legal framework.

## ğŸ“š Resources & Learning
- The 2025 Production AI Stack Report by Temporal is available, providing insights into the AI production stack.
- A camunda comparison guide is available for comprehensive comparison of leading automation technologies and platforms.
- The Kimi K2 Thinking API is available for production workloads with high uptime, scalability, and performance stability.

Total Newsletters: 7

newsletters.subject: OpenAI DROPS GPT-5.1 â€” A MAJOR Upgrade to GPT-5!
newsletters.summary:
## World of AI Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- OpenAI has released GPT-5.1, a major upgrade to GPT-5, which is faster, smarter, and offers new features.
- GPT-5.1 introduces two new modes: "Instant" for fast responses and everyday tasks, and "Thinking" for deeper reasoning and complex tasks.
- The update includes 8 new personality presets, allowing for more flexibility in tone and style.
- GPT-5.1 is expected to improve instruction-following, coding accuracy, and long-form reasoning.

### Detailed Points
- GPT-5.1 has been described as a "full reboot of the ChatGPT experience" with sharper reasoning, faster responses, and brand-new personalities.
- The "Instant" mode is optimized for fast responses, everyday tasks, and short prompts, while the "Thinking" mode is designed for hard reasoning, long chains-of-thought, coding, research, and complex tools.
- The 8 new personality presets include Default, Professional, Friendly, Candid, Quirky, Efficient, Nerdy, and Cynical, each adjusting the structure of reasoning and answer formatting.
- Early testers report better instruction-following, more accurate coding, faster response times, and tighter long-form reasoning with GPT-5.1.
- The update is significant for developers, as it provides a more predictable and reliable model for coding, with better multi-file reasoning, fewer hallucinated APIs, and more correct edge-case suggestions.
- GPT-5.1 is expected to be widely adopted, with OpenAI apps, dev tools, and chatbots likely to switch to the new model soon.
- The release of GPT-5.1 was likely accelerated due to the mixed reception of GPT-5, with OpenAI referring to it as a "ChatGPT reboot".

newsletters.subject: Disney-Level Tech, Final Hours
newsletters.summary:
## The Tech Buzz

### Key Highlights
- Elf Labs has acquired 100+ historic trademarks featuring legends like Cinderella & Snow White, positioning themselves as a major player in the character IP market, comparable to Disney.
- The company is utilizing AI-powered interactive characters, patented AR technology, and ultra-high fidelity 3D streaming to revolutionize immersive storytelling.
- Elf Labs has extended a one-time opportunity to the public to invest at $2.25 per share, with a 20% bonus on investment, before the round closes.
- The team has already generated $6B+ in licensing deals in their careers and has received two separate $70M+ acquisition offers for their IP portfolio.

### Detailed Points
- Elf Labs is creating a universe where iconic characters are living, dynamic presences, moving seamlessly between screen, toy, and physical space, using their beloved character IP to unlock a new era of immersive storytelling.
- The company's technology includes ultra-high fidelity 3D streaming, immersive digital worlds, and AI-powered talking characters and dolls, allowing audiences to interact, influence, and live inside stories.
- Elf Labs has signed two monumental deals to distribute their character IP and technology to millions across the United States and over 200 million homes worldwide.
- The company has already earned $15mm in royalties, owns 500+ trademarks and copyrights, and has 12 licensed tech patents spanning Web3, AR, and VR.
- Elf Labs is tapping into lucrative global markets, including licensed merchandise ($350B), digital gaming ($200B), TV and film ($100B), advertising and media sales ($1.15T), streaming content ($150B), and amusement parks ($50B).

newsletters.summary:
## The Rundown AI

### Key Highlights
- AI 'godmother' Fei-Fei Li's World Labs launches Marble, an editable 3D environment generator that could carry â€˜spatial intelligenceâ€™ from research hype into real creative workflows.
- OpenAI releases GPT 5.1 with new personality presets, introducing eight tone presets to steer and customize the model.
- Use ChatGPT Projects to onboard new hires by building a private, shareable workspace with uploaded SOPs, custom instructions, and project-specific memory.
- OpenAI battles court order on ChatGPT logs, calling the request an â€œinvasion of user privacy.â€

### Detailed Points
- Fei-Fei Li's World Labs launches Marble, a commercial world model that generates persistent 3D environments from text, images, videos, or 3D layouts, positioning it ahead of rivals like Google's Genie and Decart.
- Marble allows users to create new worlds via text, image, and video prompts or edit, combine, and expand on existing ones, and export worlds as Gaussian splats, meshes, or videos for use in gaming, VFX, and VR workflows.
- The model is now generally available after its initial September release in preview, offering both freemium and paid tiers starting at $20/mo.
- OpenAI releases GPT 5.1, an upgraded version of its flagship model that emphasizes a more conversational tone and new user customizations, introducing eight personality presets alongside improvements to reasoning speed.
- The release includes 5.1 Instant, which OAI describes as warmer and more instruction-focused, and Thinking, which upgrades efficiency and clarity.
- Users can select from eight tone presets (Default, Professional, Friendly, Candid, Quirky, Efficient, Nerdy, and Cynical) to steer and customize the model.
- OpenAI did not provide benchmarks for the 5.1 rollout, only showing a chart comparing the modelâ€™s time spent on easy vs. hard tasks compared to GPT-5.
- Use ChatGPT Projects to onboard new hires by building a private, shareable workspace with uploaded SOPs, custom instructions, and project-specific memory, and sharing the Project by adding the new hire's email.
- OpenAI battles court order on ChatGPT logs, calling the request an â€œinvasion of user privacy,â€ and arguing that "99.99%" of the transcripts have no connection to the copyright claims.
- A judge ruled that the requested chat logs were appropriate discovery material, saying OAIâ€™s de-identification process already protects usersâ€™ privacy.
- The NYT originally requested 1.4B chats, before narrowing to a random sample of 20M from Dec. 2022 to Nov. 2024 to look for potential copyright violations.

newsletters.summary:
## TLDR Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- OpenAI has released the GPT-5.1 family of models, including GPT-5.1 Instant and GPT-5.1 Thinking, with enhanced capabilities such as adaptive reasoning and variable deliberation.
- Waymo has started offering fully autonomous freeway rides without a human specialist in the car to fare-paying riders in the US.
- Valve has announced three new products: the Steam Frame, Steam Machine, and Steam Controller, set to be released in 2026.
- Scientists have discovered a way to make dark excitons shine brightly and controllably, opening up new possibilities for faster, smaller, and more energy-efficient technologies.
- Homebrew 5.0.0 is now available with significant changes, including download concurrency by default and official support for Linux ARM64/AArch64.

### Detailed Points
- OpenAI's GPT-5.1 models have been released to all ChatGPT users, with GPT-5.1 Instant being a high-volume model that uses adaptive reasoning and GPT-5.1 Thinking varying its deliberation for each question.
- Valve's new products include the Steam Frame, a wireless VR headset with pancake optics, the Steam Machine, a more powerful follow-up to the Steam Deck, and the Steam Controller, designed to replace a mouse.
- Waymo's self-driving taxis will take customers on freeways for the first time, with the company planning to more than double the number of cities it operates in.
- The discovery of hidden quantum light states with record 300,000x brightness has the potential to lead to breakthroughs in technologies such as quantum computing and quantum communication.
- Homebrew 5.0.0 includes major changes such as download concurrency by default, official support for Linux ARM64/AArch64, and the removal of macOS Gatekeeper bypass behaviors.
- Stripe AI provides software development kits for integrating Stripe with large language models and agent frameworks, including Agent Toolkit, AI SDK, and Token Meter.
- Coinbase plans to leave Delaware and reincorporate in Texas due to Texas' more predictable and efficient legal framework.
- Visual Studio 2026 has been released, with features such as faster performance, smarter code completion, and improved debugging tools.

newsletters.subject: Discovering effective policies for land-use planning with neuroevolution
newsletters.summary:
## JournalClub.io

### Key Highlights
- Researchers from Cognizant AI Labs in San Francisco and the University of Texas at Austin have developed a system that uses neuroevolution to discover effective policies for land-use planning, aiming to minimize carbon emissions and the cost of land-use changes.
- The system combines evolutionary optimization with surrogate modeling, learning to predict emissions from land-use changes and evolving better policies through neuroevolution.
- The approach is known as ESP: Evolutionary Surrogate-assisted Prescription, a two-stage process involving training a predictor model and using it to evolve prescriptor models.
- The predictor model is a neural network trained with supervised learning to estimate ELUC (emissions from land-use change) given context and action.

### Detailed Points
- The system addresses the challenge of "decision-making under conflicting objectives" in land-use planning, where the goal is to balance carbon emissions with the cost of land-use changes.
- The context for decision-making includes the current land-use distribution, latitude, longitude, cell area, and year, while actions represent the choices available for changing land use.
- Outcomes are measured by two conflicting metrics: ELUC (emissions from land-use change) and the percentage of land changed.
- The emissions data comes from the Bookkeeping of Land-Use Emissions (BLUE) model, and the land-use change data comes from the Land-Use Harmonization (LUH2) project.
- The predictor model is trained using PyTorch with the AdamW optimizer, and the prescriptor model is evolved using a multi-objective genetic algorithm (NSGA-II).
- The initial population includes two hand-designed seed models, and the rest of the population is initialized randomly using orthogonal initialization.
- Evolution runs for many generations with a population of around a hundred individuals, using tournament selection, Gaussian noise mutation, and crossover.
- The system has been evaluated against traditional heuristics, showing promising results in discovering effective policies for land-use planning.

### Important Links
- **Watch or Listen to the Episode**: https://journalclub.io/episodes/discovering-effective-policies-for-land-use-planning-with-neuroevolution?token=r1BLISIXNcTjNfmy3PYAXneoMcS1vaasnMjjZ41DoPmJS4eLAU - A detailed explanation of the system and its evaluation.
- **Read the Original Paper**: https://journalclub.io/track/pkRILJGG2nUSu2Qth3UZlqqk6WpDZb9Z00nq70boKV5iWiRHtC - The research paper presenting the system and its results.
- **Privacy**: https://journalclub.io/track/aVc07OvUttKmegoTA6rfDWDoPM1zGCNVjF4jGmpjq8XQw3O06j - JournalClub.io's privacy policy.
- **Preferences**: https://journalclub.io/track/rJ1rHVBb9DnsoWyJDSVQgWH0RaXcpKd0FniqoHVDWjdUEtwjlc - Options for modifying email notification preferences.
newsletters.originalContent:
Discovering effective policies for land-use planning with neuroevolution   

The point isnâ€™t to test effective land-use policies, itâ€™s to discover them. Their system learns to predict emissions from land-use changes, then uses that predictor as a surrogate to evolve better policies through neuroevolution. What makes this particularly interesting is how it scales.

![](https://journalclub.io/px/mZfk2t5HkBFLhjaBRqOebeLeTP2g3AadU1AmASfVEzxT9cpUYA)

newsletters.summary:
## TLDR AI

### Key Highlights
- OpenAI spent $5.02 billion on inference alone with Microsoft Azure in the first half of 2025.
- OpenAI has released its latest models, GPT-5.1 Instant and GPT-5.1 Thinking, which improve performance and enable more customized behavior.
- Anthropic is investing $50 billion to build AI data centers in Texas and New York with Fluidstack.
- Baidu released an open-source multimodal AI model, ERNIE-4.5-VL-28B-A3B-Thinking, which rivals the performance of larger competing systems.

### Detailed Points
- OpenAI's inference costs have risen consistently over the last 18 months and easily eclipse its revenues.
- GPT-5.1 Instant and GPT-5.1 Thinking are the latest models released by OpenAI, improving performance and enabling more customized behavior.
- Anthropic's $50 billion investment in AI data centers supports the US AI Action Plan and reflects a long-term push for domestic AI leadership.
- Baidu's ERNIE-4.5-VL-28B-A3B-Thinking model has a sophisticated routing architecture, allowing it to match or exceed the performance of larger competing systems on several categories of tasks.
- Fei-Fei Li's World Labs released Marble, its first commercial product, which turns text prompts, photos, videos, or 3D layouts into persistent, editable, and downloadable 3D environments.
- Microsoft aims to double its total data-center footprint over the next two years, with its newest AI super factory sitting within a set of two-story structures in Atlanta.
- AlphaProof, a model developed by researchers, reached silver medal performance in the International Mathematical Olympiad 2024 and demonstrates how test-time compute can be scaled to obtain improved answers.
- ElevenLabs' new AI marketplace lets brands use famous voices for ads, connecting brands with voice rights owners and ensuring permission and fair compensation.

### Important Links
- **Kimi K2 Thinking API**: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.baseten.co%2Flibrary%2Fkimi-k2-thinking%2F%3Futm_source=affiliates%26utm_medium=tldr_tech%26utm_campaign=11_13_primary_tldr%26utm_term=Model_API%26utm_content=newsletter/3/0100019a7dae5f0e-52aef648-427e-40bf-8c87-06dac340078a-000000/TOvi3k-vZ4FkMDCElN4eijAcZBdQsj8zqxKzuJs2J1E=431 (Baseten's API for production workloads with high uptime, scalability, and performance stability)
